page.title: 02TOURISM IN THE TAUNTON AREA
page.content: Taunton is a central area for tourism being situated within easy reach of two coasts and with the Quantock Hills ,Blackdown Hills and the National Parks of Exmoor and Dartmoor conveniently close. This is an important year for tourism in Taunton being the three hundredth anniversary of the Battle of Sedgemoor or the Pitchfork Rebellion as it has been called.This has been advertised abroad particularly in the U.S.A and West Indies and has brought people to the town from all over the world. There are 26 hotels and 19 guest houses offering accomodation in the town ,the largest hotels being the County Hotel with 68 rooms and the Castle Hotel with 41 rooms. Taunton's history can be traced in the County Museum in Taunton Castle.
